steps.title: Sketch an outline of the puppy’s head and body.
steps.content: Sketch an outline of the puppy’s head and body. Sketch an oblong with a slightly pointed angle on one side for the head and sketch a crossed line inside. Use an oblong for the body, make the rear part slightly thicker. Use a pencil to draw the outline so it will be easier to erase extra lines later.

steps.title: Draw an outline of the puppy’s ears and limbs.
steps.content: Draw an outline of the puppy’s ears and limbs.

steps.title: Add the puppy’s tail.
steps.content: Add the puppy’s tail. In this illustration, the tail is pointed up. Usually when dogs get excited or happy, they wag their tails or point it upwards.

steps.title: Using the cross on the face as a guide, draw the puppy’s eyes, nose and mouth.
steps.content: Using the cross on the face as a guide, draw the puppy’s eyes, nose and mouth. Take note that the dog’s nose is protruding so when drawing the nose in this view, position it slightly on the left.

steps.title: Darken desired lines from the outline of the face and body.
steps.content: Darken desired lines from the outline of the face and body. You can add soft curved lines to make the puppy look furry.

steps.title: Add spots to the drawing, if you wish.
steps.content: Add spots to the drawing, if you wish. It is common among dogs to have spots.

steps.title: Erase unnecessary lines from the outline.
steps.content: Erase unnecessary lines from the outline.
